captions.text:
No, I'm more of a
romantic comedy type person

that one must abide by in order to
successfully survive a horror movie

Rule #1: Have parents that care
about you.
Mom, Dad, can I go to a party- uh I mean, spend the night at a friends house tonight?
Ha! Stupid child, you're not leaving this house.
There's a masked murderer on the loose.
You never let me do anything!
I know someone just tried to kill you and all
but why won't you do it with me?

I'm not a slut that just puts out
all the time

you're saying you're not like your
mom?
If you are being attacked inside a house that is filled
with people, who are your friends..
you should call out for their help.
AHhhhhhhh! Help me! I'm trapped in the garage with the killer!
Hey you! Get him man!! Ahh!
Help me! I'm trapped upstairs with the killer!
Hey.. someone help me.. I'm trapped at school with the killer.

If friends aren't available, do more than
just run.
If you know the killer off his feet because he's wearing a ridiculous costume
Kick him in the throat! Do something!
The dude is going to kill you.
Don't live where the police and investigative reporters are terrible at their jobs.
Let's never ever, ever, ever, ever break up.
What do you do if the killer attacks you inside your dreams?

Well that's something entirely different. If
that happens you j-- OH NO!
Run everybody run! Forget the rules all you can do is run!

comments.author: Derick Johnson

comments.text:
+Derick Johnson Wes Craven was the director of both the original "A 
Nightmare on Elm Street", and the Scream franchise. Both movies kind of 
played with the popular tropes of horror movies from their respective eras. 
Thus it was sort of a meta commentary to include Freddy in the HISHE for 
Scream.

comments.text:
When I seen this for the first time I wrote a "How to survive a horror 
movie" in a notebook. And I watched every type of horror movie like 
Nightmare on Elm Street, Saw, Friday the 13th, and so on so I put down how 
to survive in a certain horror movie scenario.﻿

comments.author: Amina Banovic Savage

comments.text:
Well the thing about fighting killers in your mind is that you need two 
things. First, you need to be able to Lucid Dream, and realize you're 
dreaming. Second, you need more will power and skill at using dreams then 
your killer. Think of it like the magic in the Inheritance books. When you 
use magic to attack someone's mind, you need to be skillful, have a lot of 
willpower, and be able to out think them. Its sort of the same here. ﻿
